description: Excel 2016 is the powerful spreadsheet application in the Office suite. It seems every organization, large and small, uses Excel to organize and analyze data. However, many users are intimidated by Excel and confused by how it behaves as an application. The Excel 2016 Essentials series strives to empower users by learning the foundations to conquer this program. We begin with basic skills such as navigating the interface, identifying items in a spreadsheet, selecting cells, and inputting data. The series also covers formatting text and numbers, modifying a worksheet layout, printing and page layout, and managing worksheets in a workbook. While this series is designed for beginner users, it has lots of great tips and tricks for experienced users as well.

name: Excel 2016 Essentials
subtitle: Spreadsheet application

episodes.description: Excel 2016 is the powerful spreadsheet application in the Office suite. It seems every organization, large and small, uses Excel to organize and analyze data. However, many users are intimidated by Excel and confused by how it behaves as an application. The Excel 2016 Essentials series strives to empower users by learning the foundations to conquer this program. We begin with basic skills such as navigating the interface, identifying items in a spreadsheet, selecting cells, and inputting data. The series also covers formatting text and numbers, modifying a worksheet layout, printing and page layout, and managing worksheets in a workbook. While this series is designed for beginner users, it has lots of great tips and tricks for experienced users as well.
episodes.title: Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:06.270
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:06.270 --> 00:00:12.182
Hello everyone, and welcome to Excel 2016
Essentials right here on Office Pro TV.

3
00:00:12.182 --> 00:00:15.249
My name is Vonne Smith, and
in this course overview,

4
00:00:15.249 --> 00:00:19.900
we're going to be discussing what
exactly are we covering in this series?

5
00:00:19.900 --> 00:00:21.490
Who is our target audience?

6
00:00:21.490 --> 00:00:23.840
Do I need to know anything
before starting this series?

7
00:00:23.840 --> 00:00:26.729
And some extra tips and tricks.

8
00:00:26.729 --> 00:00:30.000
So what are we going to be
covering in this series?

9
00:00:30.000 --> 00:00:33.891
We have it broken up into
two main areas or topics.

10
00:00:33.891 --> 00:00:36.820
We have our introduction and
our format workbooks.

11
00:00:36.820 --> 00:00:40.754
And in the introduction, we're gonna
be covering the very, very basics,

12
00:00:40.754 --> 00:00:43.660
starting off with well,
what exactly is Excel?

13
00:00:43.660 --> 00:00:47.620
I have a PowerPoint presentation that
goes along to just really talk about like

14
00:00:47.620 --> 00:00:49.570
this is a spreadsheet application.

15
00:00:49.570 --> 00:00:51.186
What does that exactly mean?

16
00:00:51.186 --> 00:00:53.700
Well go ahead and
watch that episode and you'll find out.

17
00:00:53.700 --> 00:00:58.210
We then go ahead and move into just
some Windows and Excel basics.

18
00:00:58.210 --> 00:01:01.301
Like how do I open a file,
how do I save a file?

19
00:01:01.301 --> 00:01:03.230
Where do I go to print a file?

20
00:01:03.230 --> 00:01:06.000
What about the Excel environment?

21
00:01:06.000 --> 00:01:06.782
What is a ribbon?

22
00:01:06.782 --> 00:01:08.540
What is a quick access toolbar?

23
00:01:08.540 --> 00:01:11.130
Where do I go to customize
that quick access tool bar?

24
00:01:11.130 --> 00:01:12.580
What's the status bar?

25
00:01:12.580 --> 00:01:17.570
So we'll be covering all of those basics
in some of those introductory episodes.

26
00:01:17.570 --> 00:01:20.820
We'll also talk about how to
navigate within a workbook.

27
00:01:20.820 --> 00:01:24.842
How to get to our different worksheets,
and how to select cells,

28
00:01:24.842 --> 00:01:27.768
and what does it mean to
have an active cell, and

29
00:01:27.768 --> 00:01:31.746
what to look for when we want to
either move or copy information.

30
00:01:31.746 --> 00:01:36.518
Then we'll start selecting our information
to be able to do what I just said which is

31
00:01:36.518 --> 00:01:39.390
copy and paste and
do all those different things.

32
00:01:39.390 --> 00:01:42.665
And it's all about our mouse cursor icons,
so

33
00:01:42.665 --> 00:01:48.130
a really important area to
really focus on in Excel.

34
00:01:48.130 --> 00:01:49.931
Then we're gonna be, well,
inserting some data.

35
00:01:49.931 --> 00:01:53.070
We'll be putting in text,
we'll be putting in numbers.

36
00:01:53.070 --> 00:01:57.520
And then how do I do some really
cool things with some fill series?

37
00:01:57.520 --> 00:02:00.920
And the flash fill,
just watch that episode.

38
00:02:00.920 --> 00:02:04.230
You'll be amazed at what this
product can do for us and

39
00:02:04.230 --> 00:02:09.650
it's intelligent services if you would
say of how it's gotten so smart for us.

40
00:02:09.650 --> 00:02:11.817
It just knows what we want to do.

41
00:02:11.817 --> 00:02:16.597
And we'll also be covering how to export
your information out into different file

42
00:02:16.597 --> 00:02:21.330
formats, talking about like CSVs and
different ways that you can make PDFs.

43
00:02:21.330 --> 00:02:26.073
So how to get that file into like it's
final format to where you need to work

44
00:02:26.073 --> 00:02:26.761
with it and

45
00:02:26.761 --> 00:02:31.595
be able to send it off to maybe some
other people within your organization.

46
00:02:31.595 --> 00:02:35.840
Then we'll get in to formatting, and
format really mean change and modify.

47
00:02:35.840 --> 00:02:40.060
So we're going to be modifying
the structures of our Excel workbooks and

48
00:02:40.060 --> 00:02:44.140
worksheets with changing our
column widths, our row heights.

49
00:02:44.140 --> 00:02:47.240
How do I add or delete columns and rows.

50
00:02:47.240 --> 00:02:48.230
How do I hide things?

51
00:02:48.230 --> 00:02:49.300
How do I unhide things?

52
00:02:49.300 --> 00:02:50.990
So we'll be covering all of that.

53
00:02:50.990 --> 00:02:53.374
We'll also be formatting
in the sense of what,

54
00:02:53.374 --> 00:02:56.532
maybe a lot of people think of as
formatting as painting a font,

55
00:02:56.532 --> 00:03:00.788
making things bold, changing the colors
of different things, what about a style?

56
00:03:00.788 --> 00:03:04.777
How can I work with that and
then how can I change my themes.

57
00:03:04.777 --> 00:03:09.130
We'll also, they're all important
number formats, that's a big one like,

58
00:03:09.130 --> 00:03:13.010
why is it when I type this number in,
it's changing it to a date?

59
00:03:13.010 --> 00:03:13.851
Why does it do that?

60
00:03:13.851 --> 00:03:15.820
How can I make it stop doing that?

61
00:03:15.820 --> 00:03:18.540
How can I enforce it to do
those different things?

62
00:03:18.540 --> 00:03:20.020
Custom number formats as well.

63
00:03:20.020 --> 00:03:23.800
So lots of good information in
our number format episodes.

64
00:03:23.800 --> 00:03:27.902
We'll also be covering how to change
the page layout for printing.

65
00:03:27.902 --> 00:03:30.450
Such as doing our page breaks,
how to put in headers and

66
00:03:30.450 --> 00:03:34.610
footers, change the margins and
orientations of our workbooks.

67
00:03:34.610 --> 00:03:38.420
And then we'll end up on our
managing our workbooks and

68
00:03:38.420 --> 00:03:40.921
worksheets, how do I
change my sheet names,

69
00:03:40.921 --> 00:03:46.410
change the reorganization of those sheet
tabs as to where I want them to show.

70
00:03:46.410 --> 00:03:52.150
And how to copy and paste different
worksheets within multiple workbooks.

71
00:03:52.150 --> 00:03:56.925
So covering all the essentials
of working with Excel.

72
00:03:56.925 --> 00:04:02.520
Now one topic that we will not be covering
in this particular series is calculations.

73
00:04:02.520 --> 00:04:05.620
How to create formulas and
functions within Excel.

74
00:04:05.620 --> 00:04:09.380
That is an entirely separate
series that I have taken.

75
00:04:09.380 --> 00:04:13.960
Cuz you can use Excel for two different
ways, to just organize your information,

76
00:04:13.960 --> 00:04:18.590
and or calculate your functions and be
able to do really do this number crunches.

77
00:04:18.590 --> 00:04:23.470
And I wanted to separate those out to
really focus on those two different

78
00:04:23.470 --> 00:04:26.220
main things that Excel does for us.

79
00:04:27.500 --> 00:04:30.635
So who's our talk audience
in this particular series?

80
00:04:30.635 --> 00:04:32.375
This is all Office users.

81
00:04:32.375 --> 00:04:34.823
Now notice that Office is capitalized,

82
00:04:34.823 --> 00:04:37.991
meaning Office within
the Microsoft Office Suite.

83
00:04:37.991 --> 00:04:42.292
It doesn't mean that you have to work in
an office, like a physical location to be

84
00:04:42.292 --> 00:04:46.210
able to use this particular series
in this particular product.

85
00:04:46.210 --> 00:04:50.250
Because it can be in a large organization
or you can be the power of one and

86
00:04:50.250 --> 00:04:53.070
just have yourself being
able to use Excel.

87
00:04:53.070 --> 00:04:55.970
This does start from the very
beginning in our foundation.

88
00:04:55.970 --> 00:04:58.620
So it takes our basic information and
goes up to,

89
00:04:58.620 --> 00:05:00.894
I would say maybe an intermediate level.

90
00:05:00.894 --> 00:05:05.748
And this is where I, we talked about in
some of our episodes to where people maybe

91
00:05:05.748 --> 00:05:10.470
skip over all of the basics of Excel and
then go right into the harder stuff.

92
00:05:10.470 --> 00:05:13.350
And then when you start kinda
getting those problems, you're like,

93
00:05:13.350 --> 00:05:14.270
why isn't this working?

94
00:05:14.270 --> 00:05:18.587
It's going back to basics, learning those
foundations that can really help you.

95
00:05:18.587 --> 00:05:21.540
And everyone's like,
that's why that does that.

96
00:05:21.540 --> 00:05:25.946
So we'll be hitting all of that, and
hopefully you can gain a nice foundational

97
00:05:25.946 --> 00:05:29.849
knowledge, even if you actually have
been using Excel for some time.

98
00:05:29.849 --> 00:05:32.110
What do you need to know
about before we get started?

99
00:05:32.110 --> 00:05:36.597
Well, you need to have some familiarity
with just the Windows operating system in

100
00:05:36.597 --> 00:05:37.189
general.

101
00:05:37.189 --> 00:05:41.894
But you don't have to have any prior
knowledge of Excel to be able to

102
00:05:41.894 --> 00:05:44.343
excel in this particular series.

103
00:05:44.343 --> 00:05:49.025
Now if you have used other Office products
such as Word, or Outlook, or PowerPoint,

104
00:05:49.025 --> 00:05:52.666
then some of those things,
they cover all of the Office products,

105
00:05:52.666 --> 00:05:55.610
things like the ribbon and
the click access toolbar.

106
00:05:55.610 --> 00:05:59.800
So you might be very familiar with
some of those, but then when you get

107
00:05:59.800 --> 00:06:04.910
into how does Excel really work, that's
where you're gonna have that difference.

108
00:06:04.910 --> 00:06:07.530
Tips and tricks, our little extras.

109
00:06:07.530 --> 00:06:12.400
There's always multiple ways to do the
same thing in any of your Office products.

110
00:06:12.400 --> 00:06:14.910
So while I might show you ways one,
two and three,

111
00:06:14.910 --> 00:06:16.920
there might be four and five and six.

112
00:06:16.920 --> 00:06:20.750
There might be other ways to do things
that I might not specifically cover

113
00:06:20.750 --> 00:06:21.790
in these episodes.

114
00:06:23.020 --> 00:06:26.860
So, they're out there,
they do the same thing.

115
00:06:26.860 --> 00:06:30.420
So if you have a different way of doing
it than I do, that's totally fine.

116
00:06:30.420 --> 00:06:34.480
As long as you can get to that same
ending point then that's good.

117
00:06:34.480 --> 00:06:37.570
Updates happen, yes they do.

118
00:06:37.570 --> 00:06:41.260
And depending on if you're on
a Office 365 subscription and

119
00:06:41.260 --> 00:06:43.390
when you're updates are scheduled,

120
00:06:43.390 --> 00:06:48.760
you might not have some of the same
things that I have because you're for

121
00:06:48.760 --> 00:06:54.570
a later update than I was on when
I was filming these episodes.

122
00:06:54.570 --> 00:06:59.260
So do take that into account,
that things might look a little different.

123
00:06:59.260 --> 00:07:02.985
And then more than just that,
you have different versions of Excel.

124
00:07:02.985 --> 00:07:04.710
You're like, different versions?

125
00:07:04.710 --> 00:07:06.910
What I mean by that is
subscription levels.

126
00:07:06.910 --> 00:07:08.800
I have a Enterprise license.

127
00:07:08.800 --> 00:07:10.610
You might not have
a Enterprise license and

128
00:07:10.610 --> 00:07:14.130
that might be why I see
a certain button and you don't.

129
00:07:14.130 --> 00:07:18.970
Your network, your IT people that are
setting up your particular computer and

130
00:07:18.970 --> 00:07:21.530
where you're working in
a large organization,

131
00:07:21.530 --> 00:07:25.660
they might have locked certain features
down of your Office products or

132
00:07:25.660 --> 00:07:27.520
your subscriptions that you can't access.

133
00:07:27.520 --> 00:07:31.440
So you will have that from time
to time that will make things

134
00:07:31.440 --> 00:07:33.280
look a little different.

135
00:07:33.280 --> 00:07:35.020
Of course always searching for
the answers.

136
00:07:35.020 --> 00:07:36.930
Like why does mine not look like yours.

137
00:07:36.930 --> 00:07:40.510
You might be able to find that by,
well as we say, consulting the oracle and

138
00:07:40.510 --> 00:07:44.820
going out to Google or Bing or to whatever
search engine you have to go ahead and

139
00:07:44.820 --> 00:07:46.250
get all that information.

140
00:07:47.710 --> 00:07:49.970
Everybody uses this product differently.

141
00:07:49.970 --> 00:07:52.560
I might use Excel differently than you,
and

142
00:07:52.560 --> 00:07:55.780
you might really need to just
perform calculations and

143
00:07:55.780 --> 00:08:00.546
not have to worry about changing things
to be pink and green and different fonts.

144
00:08:00.546 --> 00:08:04.440
So, everybody has different reasons for
why they use Excel.

145
00:08:04.440 --> 00:08:07.440
But it does have that
functionality that is common,

146
00:08:07.440 --> 00:08:11.000
that how we decide to use
that functionality for

147
00:08:11.000 --> 00:08:15.890
our end result in what you need in
your workflow, it could be different.

148
00:08:15.890 --> 00:08:20.874
And of course, in all these episodes as
we like to have fun so, I keep it light.

149
00:08:20.874 --> 00:08:23.085
We're gonna be talking more
about Flago and Bishop and

150
00:08:23.085 --> 00:08:25.200
we'll be going through our Christmas Cats.

151
00:08:25.200 --> 00:08:29.035
So hopefully while learning this,
that you have fun as well.

152
00:08:29.035 --> 00:08:33.502
And hopefully we'll take some of
that pain out of knowing Excel and

153
00:08:33.502 --> 00:08:37.190
knowing exactly how to do it
will make it a lot more fun.

154
00:08:37.190 --> 00:08:39.150
So, I hope you have fun.

155
00:08:39.150 --> 00:08:43.560
I will have fun, and
I hope to see you very soon.

156
00:08:43.560 --> 00:08:48.310
[MUSIC]

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne kick off the Microsoft Excel 2016 Essentials series. They define  a spreadsheet, discuss the history of Excel and file types, and introduce other foundational concepts for this course.
episodes.title: Introduction to Excel

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne cover the basics of working with Excel in Windows operating system. They review foundational skills and items such as starting Excel, the title bar, minimize and maximize, full screen mode, create a blank workbook, open an existing workbook, save vs. save as, and keyboard shortcuts.
episodes.title: Excel Basics

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne examine  the Excel user interface (UI). Here you will learn about the title bar, the ribbon, quick access toolbar, formula bar, name box, status bar, and help.
episodes.title: Excel Interface

episodes.description: Daniel and Vonne demonstrate how to navigate a workbook . They will explain the different mouse cursors icons, scrolling, keyboard navigation, navigating with the name box, zooming, and choosing worksheets.
episodes.title: Navigate a Workbook

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne explore the multiple ways that you can select and work with cells in Excel. They demonstrate  click/hold/drag, deselecting, range selecting, selecting with shift and arrow keys, select all, select multiple worksheets, select text in multiple worksheets, named ranges, and how to use find and replace.
episodes.title: Select Cells

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne explore the variety of ways that you can insert data into your Excel worksheet. Here they cover: entering data into a cell, editing data in a cell, controlling data and cell overflow, autocorrect options, moving data to new cell, copy/paste, and clear cell data.
episodes.title: Insert Data

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne explore how to fill series  data and use the flash fill functions of Microsoft Excel 2016. These features expand the way you copy and paste data and will predict ranges like dates and common item lists.
episodes.title: Fill Series and Flash Fill

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne go through the common file types supported by Excel 2016. Here they explain .xlsx files, Comma Separated Value(.csv) files, OpenDocument Spreadsheet(.ods) files, and Excel Templates(.xltx) files.
episodes.title: Export and File Types

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne explore modifying a worksheet in Excel 2016. They demonstrate how to select columns and rows, change column height and row width, insert and delete rows/columns, hide columns and rows, merge cells, and apply word wrap to cells.
episodes.title: Modify a Worksheet

episodes.description:
"
In this episode, Daniel and Vonne show how to format a worksheet in Excel 2016. Here they talk about selecting fonts, adding borders and shading, and copying formats with the format painter. "
episodes.title: Format a Worksheet

episodes.description:
"
Daniel and Vonne continue with formatting a worksheet. In this episode, they cover aligning data in cells, cell styles, and themes."
episodes.title: Format a Worksheet Part 2

episodes.description: Vonne and Justin start a small mini series on number formats.  In this episode, they introduce number formats and discuss the difference between inputted data vs displayed data.
episodes.title: Number Formats: Introduction

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Justin cover the following number format categories: number, currency, accounting, percentage, fractions, and scientific notation.
episodes.title: Number Formats: Common Number Formats

episodes.description: Vonne and Justin continue with number formats, specifically covering the text, special, and custom categories.
episodes.title: Number Formats: Text, Special, Custom

episodes.description: Justin and Vonne finish the number format mini series by discussing date and time number formats. They also introduce the DATEVALUE function.
episodes.title: Number Formats: Date and Time

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Vonne demonstrate how to proof and control page layout for printing. They show how to spellcheck a worksheet and the options for ignoring or adding to the dictionary as well as how to use the thesaurus and smart lookup.  They also show how to modify page layout from print preview in the backstage view.
episodes.title: Proof, Print and Page Layout

episodes.description:
"
Vonne and Zach continue discussing page layout. In this episode, they show how to modify page layout elements from the page layout view such as headers and footers, page orientation, and margins. They also go over adding print titles, setting a print area, and controlling page breaks."
episodes.title: Proof, Print and Page Layout Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne finish up the Excel 2016 Essentials series by demonstrating how to manage workbooks and worksheets. Here they show you how to rename worksheet tabs, change tab color, rearrange worksheets, create new and delete worksheets, and copy/hide/move worksheets. They also show how to control view options such as freeze panes, split view, new windows, and arranging windows.
episodes.title: Manage Sheets and Workbooks
